results.title: L'Orfeo
results.brief_description: This opera, sung in Italian, was written by Claudio Monteverdi under the commission of the Duke of Mantua, who wanted the legend of Orfeo, revived in the previous century, set to music. Monteverdi combines dramatic tension, eloquent expression of human passions and formal variety in his setting of Alessandro Stiggio’s libretto. The direction, staging and design is by Jean-Pierre Ponnelle. Features singers Pillippe Huttenlocher (Orfeo), Dietlinde Turban (Euridice), Trudeliese Schmidt (Musica/Speranza), Roland Hermann (Apollo), Glenys Linos (Proserpina), Werner Groschel (Plutone), Hans Franzen (Caronte), Suzanne Calabro (Ninfa) and the Monteverdi Ensemble of the Zurich Opera House conducted by Nikolaus Harnoncourt. No English subtitles.

results.title: Lower strings; Brass; Percussion
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Hewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series examines the role of the lower strings: the cello and the double bass. Examines the effect of the invention of the valve on brass instruments and the role of percussion instruments in the orchestra.

results.title: Introduction to Orchestra!: Upper strings. Woodwind
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Hewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series provides an introduction to the methods and objectives of the series. It also examines the role of the the upper string instruments, violin and viola and the early work of Bach and Handel. It also examines the woodwind section focussing on the oboe and the use of a double reed.

results.title: Tinker tailor soldier spy
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Jonathan Powell and BBC Enterprises
results.brief_description: Dramatised for television by Arthur Hopcraft, this acclaimed adaptation of John Le Carre’s gripping novel of international espionage and betrayal stars Sir Alec Guinness in a superb portrayal of George Smiley, retired spymaster of the Circus - Britain’s spy control. He left the Circus in a storm of controversy with some saying he was sacked after the Czech scandal and others saying he is in innocent retirement. However, all agree nobody leaves the Circus without some unfinished business. Brought in to trace an infiltrator in the Department where he was once the prize employee, the self-effacing master of espionage resolutely moves in to spy on the spies and finds himself going over very old ground. This film is part of the Le Carre Trilogy. The other parts are “Smiley’s people” and “A Perfect spy”.

results.title: The Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, Susan Oliver and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1994 the ABC chose to broadcast the annual Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade live on Australian television. The decision generated much controversy but the public broadcasting of the event allowed all Australians to witness the joy and imagination involved in what is now one of the world’s leading festivals. This video of the broadcast includes footage not shown on the original screening. The Mardi Gras is a street festival in which lesbians, gays, queers and deviants can celebrate their communities and their determination to not be hidden from the public face of Australian culture. The theme of the 1994 Mardi Gras was “We Are Family” which aptly defines the strength of the Australian gay and lesbian movements in forging new forms of communal relationships which are working to challenge and destabilise homophobia. Testament to the Parade’s success is its ability to bring almost a million people onto the streets of Sydney to join in the celebrations.

results.title: Now voyager
results.creator_credit: Irving Rapper, Hal B. Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Bette Davis delivered a superlative performance as a neurotic spinster fighting to free herself from the shackles of a tyrannical mother. Pushed into a nervous breakdown, the dowdy Davis is cured by a psychiatrist (Claude Rains) and emerges as a poised and beautiful woman - only to be trapped in a doomed romance with a married man. Also stars Paul Henreid. Based on the novel by Olive Higgins Pronty.

results.title: EC, Nipper and Aku
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Nipper and Aku are great friends. They share a world of fun and imagination, and they share EC as well! ‘Cherry Pie’ - Nipper, Aku, Paul and Poss visit Grandma’s and Grandpa’s farm. They go on a treasure hunt and are treated to Grandpa’s cherry pie. ‘Aku and the Dinosaur’ - Aku pretends to be a dinosaur, but she upsets her friends when she goes too far. ‘EC belongs to everybody’ - Nipper locks EC away and won’t let Aku play with the doll. But when he finds out that he’s left out of everything, he shares EC again. ‘Aliens above’ - When Aku and Nipper hear strange noises from upstairs, they decide an alien lives there. The older kids don’t believe it, so the two of them go to find out the truth.

results.title: Tommy
results.brief_description: Using interviews with and about Tommy Woodcock, this program tells the story of one of Australia’s most renowned racehorse trainers. In particular it concentrates on his work with Phar Lap and Reckless.
results.description: Using interviews with and about Tommy Woodcock, this program tells the story of one of Australia’s most renowned racehorse trainers. In particular it concentrates on his work with Phar Lap and Reckless.

results.title: Dominators: Smith, Hayes, Cummings (S)
results.brief_description: Bart Cummings, Colin Hayes and Tommy Smith, Australia’s legendary trio of racehorse trainers. Their notoriety extends beyond the profession they have dominated for decades. Each of them possess a natural affinity with the horse: individually gifted with that enigmatic sixth sense. Record breaking achievements distinguish them from their contemporaries by the length of the Flemington straight. Their amazing winning formula applies not to hundreds of races, but thousands. Between them they’ve won 73 Derbies, 50 Oaks, 11 Cox Plates, 13 Melbourne Cups and 11 Golden Slippers. This is their success story.

results.title: The Big wet
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Hogarth, ABC-TV (Australia) and Discovery Productions
results.brief_description: The monsoon season is the most dramatic of all seasons in Australia, but each year it is different. “The Big wet” is the chronicle of a particularly wet monsoon in the tropical north. It starts with the last days of the dry in September and concludes with the first fires in April. The film looks at the effect it has on all living things in the Top End, particularly the salt-water crocodile, the wallabies and the magpie goose. Featured throughout the program is the majestic scenery of Kakadu and Arnhem Land. Narrated by John Waters.
